job_title: Human Resources Generalist in Cincinnati, OH
pros: This company has some of the best employees that you would want to work with. Everyone is helpful and caring. Usually, you will receive a 1 percent retirement share. Most of the corporate positions are remote. All other positions are hospital-based. This company has great benefits and gives you extra money to support your medical bills yearly.
cons: The pay is not so great. The company could do better at giving employees more pay. More attention needs to be paid to employee growth in the company. This company tends to change job descriptions to fit hires that they want to fill the positions.

review_title: Don't expect to get more than you give
job_title: Program Manager in Cincinnati, OH

cons: Company is now very large and struggles with high turn over. Constantly feel overwhelmed. If you take it take managers then they agree but can't really make anything better. If you are productive then either be good at binary setting or ready to work more than what is a fair share. I've grown my career with the company but it cost a lot of work life balance to break into the boys club. Non nursing support pay is not competitive. On top of that, the insurance coverage benefits have reduced over time.

review_title: Phlebotomy Management, Richmond area is poor
job_title: Certified Phlebotomy Technician in Mechanicsville, VA
pros:
-Good Benefits
-Willing to accept new/inexperienced phlebotomist
- Relativity flexible location 
-Decent Co-workers
cons:
- Underpayed
- Understaffed 
- Management is absolutely horrible, it is like a constant power contest between management. 
- Take forever to email back, unless it revolves around management and beneficial to them.
- Always walking on egg shells, and everything I do I get introuble for, never enough. 
- Management will tattle on you for every single thing you do, even if it is not in your job description. It is always back and forth with emails,explaining yourself to management. 
-Multiple people who aren't even my manager try to completely rewrite my job description and micro manage me. 

I have been extremely stressed for months since I took this job, and I do not recommend this job to anyone, especially starting phlebotomist. This company will take advantage of you, and just use you like a pawn. They do not treat you with respect, and they expect you do work there until respect is earned or given to you. Over all review this job is not worth getting paid as much as Walmart workers do, you might as well work at Walmart, at least you will be appreciated.

job_title: RN In OR in Richmond, VA

review_title: I Wouldnt If I Were You

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Richmond, VA
pros: Great team environment and great community support
cons: lack of support for nursing careers. If you are climbing the ladder administratively they will most likely promote or fill a higher up position from out of state now that Mercy Health has taken over. If you are climbing the ladder clinically there is no support for NPs, not even during clinical learning. I had an IT person tell me that I could not have access to the charting system because I am not a doctor and will never be one....an IT person told me this, so the lack of respect for teaching or allowing one to learn is so ingrained even the non-clinical people will give you a hard time. Thankfully my preceptor assisted me in working around this. She was a MD who was a NP and became a MD because she was tired of the lack of respect YEARS ago. Nothing has changed.

The “ministry” doesn’t exist anymore, now we just get constantly decreasing incentive pay, higher pt loads (7:1 on m/s as charge nurse, 6:1 on intermediate), and sicker patients. But good luck finding someone who both cares about safety AND has the ability to do anything about it! Oh well, pick your poison, I suppose.

Such a irony for a hospital with "Mercy" in their name, act so merciless. I regret my decision of taking the position at the first place. They had major layoffs in September and forced their employee to sign NDA to keep it hush.

review_title: Great Entry Level Job With High Pay
job_title: SERVICE ADVISOR in Cincinnati, OH
pros: The job provides decent pay & benefits for an entry level job.
cons:
The job is stressful with a high call-volume and occasionally rude callers, so you need to have patience. You will likely not be happy in this role if you're easily stressed. Communication within the department is not always dependable and you may be expected to make independent decisions that, if made wrong, could have a negative impact on the client. Management does not always stand behind its employees when disputes arise. 

Quality Assurance metrics, while clearly defined, can be subjective (for example, measuring your tone of voice from a scale of 1-10 is considered in the quality review. Since judging someone's tone of voice is highly interpretive, this may not be helpful nor accurately measure your performance.)

During my time at BSMH, leaders at the top often expressed and advertised their unsolicited political opinions, publishing them on the BSMH homepage as well as in internal emails, memos, meetings, and mandatory trainings. I found this unprofessional and frankly, offensive.

I would also advise anyone working here to read EVERY available resource on the Covid-19 vaccine policy, consent form, and FAQs. The information I discovered in these documents is the reason I ultimately resigned.

job_title: PT Aide/Clerk in Chesapeake, VA

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Cincinnati, OH
pros: A good place if you land with a friendly team of docs as I was.
cons: Management was toxic and not midlevel friendly. The compensation algorithm was always vague, likely on purpose as I asked three levels of management to explain and no one seemed to be able to do it. My schedules were full to the point of frequent double bookings and yet my productivity was barely above 50% at any time. Not sure what Im missing but never quite understood that!

job_title: Administration in Richmond, VA
pros:
Bon Secours Mercy Health is deeply committed to their work in the community. 
They offer competitive benefits including remote work, 403b matching and generous family leave options. They are dedicated to providing a living wage for all employees regardless of their position. They offer continuing education benefits including assistance with student loans. They provide strong health care to the community.
cons: Associates with non-medical roles often struggle with upward mobility and may often leave the ministry for their next opportunity. This system lacks clear paths for advancement and appears to look externally for higher level positions as opposed to promoting from within.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Good benefits and lots of learning experience
cons: Overworked and not paid enough

job_title: Unit Secretary in Cincinnati, OH
pros:
Benefits programs help the employees to become more healthy. Including Mercy Healthplex facilities. 

Salary could be better but is definitely better than most. 

This company cares about the health and happiness of their employees.

Company keeps employees thoroughly informed. 

Advanced technology in most area with hands on IT support.
cons:
There are many people who do not care about the work they do. It is just a job to them and because a body is better than no body, company leaders to not terminate people who do a consistently poor job. Those people are a blight on the organization overall ratings, productivity and trust scale with the community.

Please pay your workers more fair wages. If you expect someone to do the work of a manager, they should have the title, pay or both.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Richmond, VA
pros: Everyone I encountered was very kind and positive the entirety of the time I worked here

job_title: Technology Analyst in Cincinnati, OH
pros: job security, remote work, great mid-level leadership.

job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Richmond, VA
pros: The coworkers I had were amazing, however they are leaving in droves.
cons: I have wanted to work for bon secours since I graduated about 6 years ago. I finally was able to achieve this dream about 3 years ago and it was a seriously terrible experience. In the time I was there the merger with mercy health took place/was completed and subsequently everything went down hill. No support from management and the company during the start of covid, direct management in my department (I’m a clinician) was horrible, poor pay and reduced benefits once the merger took place (ie. copays went up etc.) Highly recommend avoiding this place for now. Customer service both internally, like IT, office communication etc and externally were very poor. Hopefully with word getting around regarding how awful they have become as a company will prompt a change in a few years..

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Warren, OH
pros:
Coworkers are like family. 
Patient doctors. 
Flexible schedule. 
Small OR.
cons:
Lots of call and long days. 
Management is poor.
Somewhat disorganized. 
Poor wages.

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner HRBP in Richmond, VA
pros: Okay I guess . Could be better
cons: Poor management skills overall, could definitely improve in that area

job_title: Material Management Technician in Richmond, VA
pros: Good hours and competitive pay
cons: Physical labor and lots of walking

review_title: Not the worst, not the best (i have nothing to compare it to though)
job_title: Registered Nurse in Youngstown, OH
pros: Pay rate for Market Float position is great, still low for core staff but they HAVE been increasing over the years. Current incentive pay for additional shift is great! Benefits standard, not terrible.
cons: Lack of standard of care between floors/hospitals, need to re-vamp training across the board, some floors in dire need of updates, need better ratios at some hospitals, need better benefits package, some management needs better communication.

review_title: An all around above average employer
job_title: Nursing Professional Development Coordinator in Columbus, OH
pros:
-Strong network of nurse leaders and educators. 
-Organization leverages talent versus letting them go elsewhere. 
-leadership staff struggle with a disconnect between ministry objectives and the market level decision making.
-A more progressive management approach than what you find in most hospitals. 
-innovation is well received
-TONS of opportunity for vertical and lateral movement with an emphasis on best fit for the employer AND the employee.
cons:
-leadership staff struggle with a disconnect between ministry objectives and the market level decision making.
-Nursing shortages have made professional development and leadership empowerment at the market level a “back burner” issue. This lack of growth creates stagnation. This is improving.
- Lack of diversity in leadership. 
-Bias is apparent and observable. 
-because they leadership doesn’t resemble the staff, they struggle to empathize with them.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Arlington, VA
pros: Great pay and benefits. They are also willing to work w your availability, which is great! My manager provides resources for extra skill sets that you may want to learn. Overall I’m very pleased to work for such a great organization.
cons: Support help can be limited and ratios can be 1-7, which I understand can be everywhere. They are working on safer ratios

job_title: Deskside Analyst in Greenville, SC
pros: Overall a good company to work for. They could pay a bit more though.
cons: Salary and pay raises could improve.

job_title: Lead Medical Technologist Leader in Warren, OH
pros: Basic benefit package like medical
cons: I escaped this job due to mistreatment from facility, inappropriate personal contact, and poor response to ethical concerns. Manager concerned about people skills? Let me say I expect a level of professionalism and so should you.

job_title: Senior EHR Analyst in Richmond, VA
pros: Great direction, strong leadership, innovative
cons: Retain senior employees who are not productive

job_title: Registered Nurse in Toledo, OH

job_title: Registered Nurse in Greenville, SC
pros:
Easy to get a job

Turnover rate

job_title: Nurse Supervisor in Austintown, OH
pros: They offer medical insurance at a reduced cost.
cons: This company has become a shell of itself over the 6 years I have worked here. Management cares nothing for the employee only meeting budget for their bonuses. The company is unprofessional at the top which shows in how management conducts itself. I would not recommend. This company just sold off all extended living facilities without so much as a word to anyone which has put many of us in a disastrous situation. We are nothing more than a body to meet required guidelines and help produce profit at low wages. It's taken me 6 years to make 4$ more an hour than I did with 1 less degree, which they require you to obtain with in 5 years.

job_title: Registered Nurse Float Pool in Newport News, VA

cons: always need nurses and always short staffed

System remote opportunities
well run organization

review_title: If you do more than what's expected, then that's what will be expected of you.
job_title: EVS Associate in Chesterfield, VA
pros: Good benefits (Health, vision, dental)
cons:
Low staff due to higher-ups. More work is place on associates when someone calls out or quits. Leads to poor management.
Not much opportunities outside the department, even when earning a higher education.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Midlothian, VA
pros: If i could give negative stars I would. Since Mercy took over Bon Secours, St Franis has gone from moderately bad to horrendous. Throughout the pandemic nurses have been largely left to our own with new rules that changed by the minute and little communication. They are a Magnet facility where nurses were encouraged to inflate the culture there with a promise of a raise that didn't come until Mercy health decided to give everyone a raise a year later. Changes come out of left field and admin lacks communication to even share with their frontline staff.
cons: There is nothing good to say.

job_title: Supply Chain Technician in Toledo, OH
pros: I work with some of the most friendly and supportive people at Mercy Health
cons:
I feel like the amount of work that was being put on the techs did not match up with how much we were being paid.

We are put in a high-stress environment where we are communicating with all sorts of nurses/doctors, while at the same time doing physical labor.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Richmond, VA
pros: Pay is the best in the area

review_title: I have been here for over a year so that has to say something

job_title: Marketing Specialist in Bond Hill, OH
pros: Company culture and atmosphere were good. Employees were nice and respectful. Pay and benefits were good. Corporate facilities were excellent: onsite gym, pharmacy, doctor office and cafeteria.
cons: HR and Leadership could improve presence and communication. More opportunities for new employees to engage with others.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Norfolk, VA

review_title: Great EHR Team. Awful HR Decisions
job_title: Applications Coordinator in Cincinnati, OH
pros: If you work on the EHR side of Bon Secours Mercy Health you will find that the leadership is going the extra miles to try and make open communication a priority. They really are very invested in making staff as happy as possible and are very clear about their expectations.
cons:
Although we have a great EHR team who tries to go the extra mile, the rest of the leadership is doing the opposite. HR has made severe cuts to benefits such as:
- reducing who qualifies for PTO increases
- less flexibility in work from home structure
- terrible short term disability policy
- no sick bank hours
- worse health insurance
- no clear career paths

You would think that a healthcare company who states that they are trying to serve the under-served and allow its employees to thrive would follow its' own message. However, that is simply a smoke screen. Bottom line, the rest of the company doesn't care about you as an employee. If you work there for years, don't expect to be rewarded. 

It is pretty clear HR and the leadership who approved these policies are only providing the bare minimum legally required benefits in order to make a buck.

job_title: Supply Chain Intern in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Great people and great management.
cons: Slow upward mobility towards promotion. Degrees can be overly valued.

review_title: My expectation was so far off from the reality.
job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Toledo, OH
pros: My practice manager is who is keeping me here. Without her, I'd run the other way.  The providers are great and they make work enjoyable but we don't see them much.  I think the company has the right intentions just door executions.
cons:
I was shocked at how low my pay rate was, and even more shocked at how horrible the benefits were. As a health system, the assumption would be that they would offer at least decent health benefits.  I honestly can't believe my health benefits are so horrible.  
Providers don't feel supported or cared about so people are leaving. I've seen 3 providers leave and 2 threaten to leave within 4 months.

job_title: Applications Coordinator in Cincinnati, OH
pros: The only reason I remained working here for as long as I did is because I genuinely loved my team. Everyone is passionate, helpful, and great people to work alongside.  Coffee shop at the Cincinnati Home Office is the only other thing that brought my joy while working here.
cons: Everything besides my team was negative in my experience. Typical corporate environment where you are micromanaged to the ground, underpaid and overworked, benefits got continuously taken away. Lack of communication between upper level leadership and middle management. We used to have bi-annual day-long retreats with our team but those ended once the merger occurred. There is not any room for growth on the CarePATH/ConnectCare teams and the management is totally inept.

review_title: Bon Secours is very different than when I started working for them.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Richmond, VA
pros: Vacation time,  health insurance but quality and cost of health insurance  has gone down hill.
cons: Mercy Health the company that acquired Bon Secours is laying off those that have served the communities with compassion and loyalty.  There have been mass layoffs this year.  This is not the same company I worked for 2 years ago or even 12 years ago.  It is really unfortunate they are treating long time employees like they are.  I myself worked for Bon Secours as well as my wife.  We have both noticed drastic negative changes since the acquisition.   There is no compassion from executives and people will turn their back on you in a second.

job_title: Registrar in Cincinnati, OH
pros: I liked working for Mercy. Thought they were fair in wages. Need sick time as you are exposed to so much illness.
cons: I had two managers during my employment. I felt neither of them should have been managers. They showed favoritism to employees. Became their friends instead of just being a manager to all. They missed alot of work!! Upper management was spread so thin they weren’t there to help. Felt like they listened but nothing was ever done about your complaints.

review_title: An overall great place to grow and learn
job_title: Critical Care RN in Fairfield, OH
pros: At the Fairfield location everyone feels like family. There is no hesitation from senior nurses to teach the newer staff. The staff are very dedicated to patient wellbeing. Management genuinely care about staff and coach with positivity.
cons: Pay could be better. Through my entire career people I graduated with make a higher hourly wage. I understand that this is not really my managers fault but more the scale on which the system uses.

review_title: Wonderful company to work for! Like a big family! Faith-based.
